intro: Psychotria loretensis, commonly known as the Loretto psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in cloud forests. The plant is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to fully understand its botanical significance.
